entities.description: "The Federal Reserve, often referred to as the Fed, is a central banking system in the United States, responsible for setting monetary policy, including interest rates, to control inflation."
"Florida is a state in the southeastern region of the United States, mentioned in the context of Hurricane Idalia causing damage along its western coast."
"Hurricane Idalia was a Category 3 hurricane that made landfall in Florida, causing flooding, wind damage, and two deaths due to traffic accidents."
"Horseshoe Beach is a location in Florida that suffered damage from Hurricane Idalia."
"Cedar Key is a group of tiny islands in Florida that experienced the effects of Hurricane Idalia, with residents describing a night of howling winds and flying debris."
"Crystal River is a coastal city in Florida where residents, including Doug Nicholson, experienced rising floodwaters due to Hurricane Idalia."
"Georgia is a state in the southeastern United States, mentioned as being affected by Hurricane Idalia after it was downgraded to a tropical storm."
"South Carolina is a state in the southeastern United States, mentioned as facing danger from Hurricane Idalia after it was downgraded to a tropical storm."
"Hurricane Ian was a deadly storm that made landfall in Southwest Florida, causing 150 deaths and over $112 billion in damage."
"Ron DeSantis is the Governor of Florida, who reported that Hurricane Idalia knocked out power for 250,000 residents."
"Russia is a country in Eastern Europe and Asia, mentioned in the context of an assault following months of missile and drone strikes on Ukrainian cities."
"Ukraine is a country in Eastern Europe, mentioned in the context of遭受俄罗斯的导弹和无人机袭击。"
"Big Gay Ice Cream is a New York City-based soft-serve chain that has faced financial difficulties and legal disputes, reducing its number of locations to one."
"Doug Quint is a founder and partner of Big Gay Ice Cream who filed a lawsuit against another partner, Jon Chapski, for alleged mismanagement and fraud."
"Jon Chapski is a partner in Big Gay Ice Cream, accused by Doug Quint of mismanagement and fraudulently collecting government loans during the pandemic."
"Tallahassee is the capital city of Florida, mentioned as a reference point for the location where Hurricane Idalia made landfall."
"Donna Knight is a clammer from Cedar Key, Fla., who described her experience during Hurricane Idalia."
"Doug Nicholson is a resident of Crystal River, who observed the rising floodwaters during Hurricane Idalia."
"Charleston is a city in South Carolina, where forecasters warned of dangerous coastal inundation due to Hurricane Idalia."
"Moscow is the capital city of Russia, mentioned in the context of deadly missile and drone strikes on Ukrainian cities."
"Oleksandr is a Ukrainian official who discusses the attacks by Russia, though no last name is provided in the text."

relationships.description: "Hurricane Idalia caused significant damage along Florida's western coast, including flooding and wind damage."
"Horseshoe Beach was one of the locations in Florida damaged by Hurricane Idalia."
"Cedar Key experienced the effects of Hurricane Idalia, with residents describing a night of howling winds and flying debris."
"Hurricane Idalia made landfall southeast of Tallahassee, Florida, in a marshy and thinly populated area."
"Donna Knight, a resident of Cedar Key, described her harrowing experience during Hurricane Idalia."
"Doug Nicholson, a resident of Crystal River, observed the effects of Hurricane Idalia on his neighborhood."
"Charleston, South Carolina, was warned of dangerous coastal inundation due to Hurricane Idalia."
"Moscow is the city from which Russia has launched deadly missile and drone strikes on Ukrainian cities."
"Oleksandr, a Ukrainian official, discusses the attacks by Russia on Ukrainian cities, infrastructure, and military targets."

entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper that contains the article about Chile's search for missing people and other news."
"Fernando Ortíz was a 50-year-old professor who was kidnapped in 1976 during the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet in Chile."
"Gen. Augusto Pinochet was the dictator of Chile from 1973 to 1990, during which time numerous people, including Fernando Ortíz, were abducted and disappeared."
"Simón Bolívar is the name of the secret torture center where many, including Fernando Ortíz, were taken and never returned."
"DINA, or the regime’s intelligence agency, ran the secret torture center Simón Bolívar during Pinochet's dictatorship."
"Chile is the country where the military rule led to the disappearance of 1,469 people from 1973 to 1990, and where a national search plan has been enacted to find the remaining disappeared."
"Gabriel Boric is the President of Chile who signed a presidential decree to codify the national search plan for the disappeared."
"Luis Cordero is Chile’s minister of justice and human rights, who has emphasized the state's responsibility in the search for the disappeared."
"Argentina is a South American country that has had some success in recovering the remains of their disappeared, with forensics teams identifying 800 out of 1,400 bodies recovered."
"Brazil is a South American country with efforts to find 210 missing people that have had scant results."
"Paraguay is a South American country with an agency tasked with finding and identifying 336 disappeared people, of which only 34 have been discovered."
"Russia is the country from which a wave of exploding drones was launched, damaging military cargo planes and indicating Ukraine's capability to strike inside Russian territory."
"Ukraine is the country that launched a wave of exploding drones into Russia and experienced an aerial assault from Russia, with Kyiv being particularly affected."
"Hurricane Idalia, which was downgraded to a tropical storm, caused damage along the coastal regions, including Florida's Horseshoe Beach, Cedar Key, and Crystal River."
"PASCAL BONNEFOY is the author of the article in The New York Times about Chile's search for missing people."
"COMMUNIST LEADERS refers to the group of people, including Fernando Ortíz, who were rounded up and sent to a torture center during the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet."
"MILITARY RULE refers to the period from 1973 to 1990 in Chile under which 1,469 people disappeared."
"NATIONAL SEARCH PLAN is the initiative enacted by Chile to track down the remaining disappeared people before the 50th anniversary of the coup."
"LATIN AMERICA is the region where Chile is located, and where several countries, including Chile, had military dictatorships that led to the disappearance of many people."
"SURVIVING FAMILY MEMBERS refers to the relatives of the disappeared who have been primarily responsible for the search efforts until the enactment of the national search plan."
"ESTONIA is a NATO member near Russia, where an airfield was damaged by exploding drones, indicating Ukraine's capability to strike inside Russian territory."
"KYIV is the capital of Ukraine, which experienced one of the most significant barrages in months, including the death of two people due to falling debris."
"SERHIY POPKO is the head of the Kyiv regional military administration, who reported on the casualties and damage caused by the aerial assault on Kyiv."
"PERSONAL CONSUMPTION EXPENDITURES INDEX is the Fed’s preferred inflation measure, which is expected to tick up, indicating the persistence of inflation above the Fed’s 2 percent goal."

relationships.description: "The New York Times Company published an article about Chile's efforts to search for missing people from the Pinochet era."
"Fernando Ortíz was abducted and disappeared during the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet."
"Fernando Ortíz was sent to the secret torture center Simón Bolívar where he disappeared."
"The secret torture center Simón Bolívar was run by the regime’s intelligence agency DINA."
"PASCAL BONNEFOY is an author writing for The New York Times Company."
"COMMUNIST LEADERS were targeted and rounded up during the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet."
"MILITARY RULE occurred in Chile, leading to the disappearance of 1,469 people."
"NATIONAL SEARCH PLAN is an initiative by the Chilean government to find the remaining disappeared people."
"Chile is a part of LATIN AMERICA, where several countries experienced military dictatorships."
"SURVIVING FAMILY MEMBERS in Chile have been primarily responsible for the search efforts until the national search plan was enacted."

entities.description: "The Big Gay Ice Cream Truck is an organization that participated in the Brooklyn Pride parade, gaining popularity in a wave of pop culture."
"The annual Brooklyn Pride parade is an event where the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck first appeared in 2009, marking a cultural shift."
"RuPaul’s Drag Race is a pop culture hit that contributed to the wave of cultural change during the time when the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck first appeared."
"Lady Gaga is a pop culture figure known for her song 'Born This Way,' which was part of the cultural shift in the same period as the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck's debut."
"Orange Is the New Black is a pop culture hit that was part of the wave of change when the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck first appeared at the Brooklyn Pride parade."
"The Cowichan River in Canada is a geographical location that experienced the biggest die-off in living memory, potentially due to climate change."
"Gabon is a geographical location where a coup was declared, with President Ali Bongo Ondimba being detained after a disputed election."
"Ali Bongo Ondimba is the President of Gabon who was detained after being declared the winner of a disputed election."
"President Biden is focusing on a policy that lowers drug costs for his re-election campaign, which is effective if people are aware of it."
"The U.S. has enough geothermal energy to power the entire country, and some are trying to unlock it using techniques from the fracking boom."
"Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader, has raised questions about his future after freezing in front of reporters for the second time this summer."
"Morgan Riddle is a person who draws attention at pro tennis matches, where she cheers for her boyfriend Taylor Fritz."
"Taylor Fritz is a professional tennis player who has Morgan Riddle as his supporter at matches."
"The event in 2015 when marriage was legalized for same-sex couples across the country."
"Climate change is suggested as a potential cause for the biggest die-off in living memory on the Cowichan River in Canada."
